# init(rect:options:owner:userInfo:)

**Initializer**

Initializes and returns an object defining a region of a view to receive mouse-tracking events, mouse-moved events, cursor-update events, or possibly all these events.

## Declaration

```swift
init(rect: NSRect, options: NSTrackingArea.Options = [], owner: Any?, userInfo: [AnyHashable : Any]? = nil)
```

## Parameters

- **rect**: A rectangle that defines a region of a target view, in the view’s coordinate system, for tracking events related to mouse tracking and cursor updating. The specified rectangle should not exceed the view’s bounds rectangle.
- **options**: One or more constants that specify the type of tracking area, the situations when the area is active, and special behaviors of the tracking area. See the description of [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTrackingArea/Options-swift.struct] and related constants for details. You must specify one or more options for the initialized object for the type of tracking area and for when the tracking area is active; zero is not a valid value.
- **owner**: The object to receive the requested mouse-tracking, mouse-moved, or cursor-update messages. It does not necessarily have to be the view associated with the created `NSTrackingArea` object, but should be an object capable of responding to the `NSResponder` methods [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSResponder/mouseEntered(with:)], [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSResponder/mouseExited(with:)], [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSResponder/mouseMoved(with:)], and [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSResponder/cursorUpdate(with:)].
- **userInfo**: A dictionary containing arbitrary data for each mouse-entered, mouse-exited, and cursor-update event. When handling such an event you can obtain the dictionary by sending [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSEvent/userData] to the `NSEvent` object. (The dictionary is not available for mouse-moved events.) This parameter may be `nil`.

## Return Value

The newly-initialized tracking area object.

## Discussion

After creating and initializing an `NSTrackingArea` object with this method, you must add it to a target view using the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSView/addTrackingArea(_:)] method. When changes in the view require changes in the geometry of its tracking areas, the Application Kit invokes [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSView/updateTrackingAreas()]. The view should implement this method to replace the current `NSTrackingArea` object with one with a recomputed area.

### Special Considerations

Beginning with OS X v10.5, the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTrackingArea/init(rect:options:owner:userInfo:)], along with the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSView/addTrackingArea(_:)] method of `NSView`, replace the `NSView` method [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSView/addTrackingRect(_:owner:userData:assumeInside:)].

## Related Documentation

- **userInfo**: The dictionary containing the data associated with the receiver when it was created.
- **rect**: The rectangle defining the area encompassed by the receiver.
- **owner**: The object owning the receiver, which is the recipient of mouse-tracking, mouse-movement, and cursor-update messages.
- **options**: The options specified for the receiver.
